eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Ahnaf30e
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FPS
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Calculate and display the frames per second (FPS) of the game.
description: Provides an expression to get the current FPS and a text object behavior to display the current FPS.
Frames Per Second (FPS) describes how many times in the last second your game logic was executed.
This includes running behaviors and events, and then rendering the new game state into the game window. The higher the FPS, the more fluid and performant your game looks.
Note: Use the Performance Profiler (inside in the Debugger) for detailed performance information about your game.

events.name: Keep timestamps for every frame inside the lookback period

events.comment: Record how much time has elapsed
Remove any data before the last second from the beginning of the array
Add the current timestamp to the end of the array

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteSlider
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
description: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value. The slider can be customized with sprites.
There are ready-to-use sliders in the asset-store [settings UI pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=settings-ui-settings-ui).

eventsBasedObjects.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteSlider

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label that is displayed over the thumb.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

parameters: max(Background.BoundingBoxRight(), max(Label.BoundingBoxRight(), Thumb.BoundingBoxRight())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxLeft(), min(Label.BoundingBoxLeft(), Thumb.BoundingBoxLeft()))
max(Background.BoundingBoxBottom(), max(Label.BoundingBoxBottom(), Thumb.BoundingBoxBottom())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxTop(), min(Label.BoundingBoxTop(), Thumb.BoundingBoxTop()))

events.comment: The parent size is not defined in onCreate so it needs to be done here.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FaceForward
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Face object towards the direction of movement.
description: Set the angle of the object to match the direction of movement.
This works with any kind of movement (forces, physics, dragging, etc) because it tracks the object position to compute the direction of movement.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Face object towards the direction of movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FaceForward

events.comment: Make sure the object has moved
Save movement direction as a property so the user can use it
Rotate the object to face the direction it is moving towards
Save the current position to be used in the next frame

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Bounce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
This *won't work* with Physics engine or Platformer characters. This is working with objects that are moved using actions or behaviors using **the forces**.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Bounce

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOff

events.comment:
To bounce the object realistically, we first separate it from the obstacle. The collision engine will do it by moving the object through the shortest "normal vector" of the edge that was collided.
We store the position of the object before being moved so that we know the angle of this "normal vector". Once we know it, we add a force in the direction of the normal vector, and we add the difference between the normal vector and the previous angle of movemement.
